diagnosis.final_diagnosis: gallstone pancreatitis with vasodilatory SIRS shock and necrotizing pancreatitis
diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The patient presented with severe RUQ pain, which progressed to diffuse abdominal pain and was accompanied by mild nausea. Imaging and clinical findings indicated complications of gallstone pancreatitis, including vasodilatory shock, necessitating various surgical interventions and diagnoses of necrotizing pancreatitis.
